comments.author: hanna
comments.content: Ahhh, I have a high spice tolerance, so I tend to up the heat when making this seasoning. My favorite use? Take a plate of shrimp fried rice, top it with a soft egg, then dust the top with this seasoning magic. YUM!

comments.author: Hnlmark
comments.content: Not spicy at all. Of course, using your recipe is a cut above, so why not make your own!  But I vaguely remember seeing this packaged stuff at Uwajimaya. I just did a quick search to refresh my memory and sure enough there is a "Hawaii Popcorn Company" that sells packets of microwave popcorn with toppings that include mochi crunch (rice crackers), nori and butter flavoring.

comments.author: Trudy ~ veggie num num
comments.content: What a great idea.. am tossing all sorts of alternative uses for this around in my head already! thanks for the great recipe!

comments.author: kim
comments.content: I love playing with popcorn seasoning!  I can't wait to try this recipe, but does the seasoning stick well to the popcorn without any kind of oil ingredient?  Usually when I add parmesan or flavored salts it just ends up at the bottom of the bowl.  Any tips to solve this?

comments.author: Melissa of Lovely Android
comments.content: Yum! I love nori and I love seasoned popcorn. I agree with Kim's comment though that most of the seasoning ends up at the bottom of the bowl. Thanks for the recipe! I will definitely be trying this.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: @Kim, @Melissa - I make my popcorn the traditional way, in a big pot with a bit of oil, so there is something for the seasoning to stick to. This stuff is ground so fine it doesn't take much fat at all. But if you are an air-popper than yeah, you will need to add something to create a little stickiness.

comments.author: jim
comments.content: M, what kind of oil do you use?  Vegi? Peanut? Coconut?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I tend to use Spectrum High Heat Safflower oil as my general purpose neutral oil, and it works fine for popcorn.
